body_html: My team has been working on a distributions library on top of Pytorch, and we'd be happy to move that code upstream. We have implemented: Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Cauchy, Delta, Dirichlet, Exponential, Gamma, HalfCauchy, LogNormal, Multinomial, Normal (univariate, multivariate, and multivariate w/ Cholesky), Poisson, and Uniform. Some of these just use scipy under the hood, and some only have cpu implementations. We're hoping to open source next week.

We have implemented: Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Cauchy, Delta, Dirichlet, Exponential, Gamma, HalfCauchy, LogNormal, Multinomial, Normal (univariate, multivariate, and multivariate w/ Cholesky), Poisson, and Uniform. Some of these just use scipy under the hood, and some only have cpu implementations. We're hoping to open source next week.
body: My team has been working on a distributions library on top of Pytorch, and we'd be happy to move that code upstream. We have implemented: `Bernoulli`, `Beta`, `Categorical`, `Cauchy`, `Delta`, `Dirichlet`, `Exponential`, `Gamma`, `HalfCauchy`, `LogNormal`, `Multinomial`, `Normal` (univariate, multivariate, and multivariate w/ Cholesky), `Poisson`, and `Uniform`. Some of these just use `scipy` under the hood, and some only have cpu implementations. We're hoping to open source next week.
